project.teaser: METAWAVE proposes the introduction of advanced microwave-based heating systems in high-temperature heating processes. Its key outcome is the demonstration of these systems in three industrial sectors (ceramics, asphalt, aluminium) achieving superior performance. Process...
project.objective: METAWAVE proposes the introduction of advanced microwave-based heating systems in high-temperature heating processes. Its key outcome is the demonstration of these systems in three industrial sectors (ceramics, asphalt, aluminium) achieving superior performance. Process efficiency, energy use, GHG emissions and productivity are the main metrics that define the positioning of the project results on the industrial innovation atlas. The advantages of higher system efficiency, shorter process time and process controllability have the potential of bringing the twin-transition one step closer, helping the process industries to reduce the energy demand and leverage their overall flexibility. Further optimisation requires feedstock enhancement with novel nanostructured additives, waste-based refractories for advanced process monitoring and controls as well as robust modelling and predictive functions for the Process Digital Twin. METAWAVE will target seamless integration of renewable energy sources to power the microwave-based heating systems through Virtual Power Plant (VPP) configurations, accompanied by an energy management system based on data-driven modelling optimisation and alongside the investigation of industrial symbiosis developing a detailed Hub 4 Circularity (H4C) roadmap. A complete assessment of the techno-economic feasibility of the novel technologies and their environmental impact will be conducted paving the way towards their up-scale and commercial adoption. METAWAVE will mobilise different stakeholders into new ways of operating process industries through capacity building, open science, and new forms of sustainable economic activity with an emphasis on sustainable fuels and feedstocks. 7 SMEs along with 6 RTDs, 2 universities and 3 large enterprises work together to achieve 420 GWh energy reduction, over 95ktCO2 averted and more than 19% productivity increase yielding total revenues of more than 230M€ and the creation of more than 900 new jobs by 2032.
project.title: High-temperature heating processes with breakthrough microwave and digital technologies for increased energy efficiency
project.keywords: digitalisation, digital twin, energy-intensive industrial sectors, energy efficiency, energy flexibility, microwave-based heating, data-driven models, physics-driven models, decision support

article.title: Reducing energy demand in high-temperature process industries

result.title: Regulatory and standardization report - early phase
result.description: This deliverable consists of a report on standards employed and regulations relevant to METAWAVE (output from T10.6). EUROCORE will monitor and report any emerging initiatives, new legislation, or other developments that could potentially influence the project's progress. Furthermore, regarding the standardization monitoring efforts, EUROCORE will analyze existing standards and ongoing standardization progress in several relative areas of METAWAVE, with the collaborative support of all project partners.

result.title: Temperature-induced microstructure evolution of geopolymer-copper slag compositesimplications on high-temperature applications

details.authors: M. Lassinantti Gualtieri*, E. Colombini*, C. Leonelli and P. Veronesi**
details.journalTitle: 12th International Conference on Sustainable Solid Waste Management

result.title: Materials selection and characterization
result.description: The deliverable, in the form of a report, involves the characterization of usable raw materials and feedstock, by defining performance indexes addressing the suitability of such materials to be used in presence of high frequency electromagnetic fields and at high temperature. Particularly, it includes the materials selection charts, realized using the CES software provided by UMORE (output from T2.1), the report on modelling of nanostructured additives provided by AVANZ (output from T2.2) and the refractory designs for IUC1-3 provided by UMORE (output from T2.3)

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - METAWAVE (High-temperature heating processes with breakthrough microwave and digital technologies for increased energy efficiency)
result.teaser: Process industries are central to the European economy, transforming raw materials into essential products. However, they are highly energy-intensive and heavily reliant on fossil fuels, particularly for process heating, which accounts for about 50% of industrial energy use in...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Training and engagement activities & strategy – early phase
result.description: This deliverable involves the first battery of training activities provided by KMOP, which will set the scene for the co-creation and implementation of training addressed to personnel in the targeted industries. It includes three (3) real-time webinars of approximately 2 hours in duration (output from T10.3).

category.title: renewable energy
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/energy and fuels/renewable energy

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
